basics.description: FinOps hubs are a reliable, trustworthy platform for cost analytics, insights, and optimization. Connect your hub to one or more billing accounts and subscriptions and build custom reports in Power BI or other tools. [Learn more](https://aka.ms/finops/hubs)

basics.name: hubName
basics.label: Name
basics.toolTip: Name of the hub. Used to ensure unique resource names.

constraints.validationMessage: Name must be between 3 and 63 characters long and can contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. The first and last characters in the name must be alphanumeric.

basics.name: storageSku
basics.label: Storage redundancy
basics.toolTip: The data in your storage account is always replicated to ensure durability and high availability. Choose a replication strategy that matches your durability requirements. [Learn more](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2163103)

options.text: FinOps hubs relies on Event Grid to know when Cost Management exports data. To use Event Grid, the resource provider MUST be registered. If you're upgrading a hub instance or have already registered the Event Grid resource provider, you can skip Event Grid registration.

elements.name: skipEventGridRegistration
elements.label: Event Grid is already registered
elements.toolTip: If upgrading a working hub instance, check this box. If this is a new hub deployment and are not sure if Event Grid is registered, leave unchecked. To confirm, navigate to the subscription and select Resource providers in the menu, then find the Event Grid resource provider and see if it has a status of Registered. [Learn more](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-resource-manager/management/resource-providers-and-types#register-resource-provider)

options.text: If Event Grid is not registered, we will deploy a temporary resouce to this location. If emppty, we will use the hub location. Event Grid is not supported in all regions, which may cause failures. If you face an error, please select a different region for Event Grid. If you continue to face errors, check the 'Event Grid is already registered' box above to skip this.

elements.name: eventGridLocation
elements.label: Event Grid location
elements.toolTip: Leave this empty to use the hub location or nearest location. You should only need to specify this if that deployment fails with an unsupported Event Grid region error. If so, specify one of the suggested regions here and retry the deployment.
